result.execSummary:
The defendant Luis Alfredo Oliveras was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.
Attendance to Victim Impact Panel Meeting on 6/17/2015 or 30 days huber consecutive.

miscConds.notes:
BAIL APPLIED OF $203.00 to her fine.  Remaining balance to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
BAIL APPLIED. DNA PAID IN FULL.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
Not to be present on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol.(bars, taverns or liquor stores)
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Cases 14TR6779 and 14TR16778 were both dismissed and read into: 14CF1316.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Luis Alfredo Oliveras in court with attorney Jeffrey William Purnell.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 1,  Court finds defendant guilty.

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- Total sentence: 4 years (Initial Confinement: 2 years, Extended Supervision: 2 years)  Stayed for 3 years Probation
-  36  months Drivers License Revocation. 
-  36  months Ignition Interlock every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to defendant
- Attendance at the Victim Impact Panel meeting on jUNE 17, 2015 or 30 days Huber consecutive.
- Alcohol Assessment 
- Blood Test Reimbursement of $35.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to Wisconsin State Patrol -  append to fine - to be paid as a condition of probation 
- Fine totaling: $1469.00 to be paid as a condition of probation - apply bail
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 - append to fine - to be paid as a condition of probation
- Fees of $12.00 for search warrant - append to fine - to be paid as a condition of probation
- Conditions of  Probation: Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s..  AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.  Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No drug paraphernalia. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; Inform Agent of all prescriptions. Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling or any other approved activity by agent. No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e. bars, taverns, or liquor stores).  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
 -  1 year with huber Condition Time (nonworking hours) commencing FORTHWITH. Non working hours with standard release conditions. 
Defendant was remanded to the custody of the Sheriff to commence the sentence.
Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: 4/17/15.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 17, 2015 at 09:30 am.

for Non-Compliance with WCS   EXT=Code 3
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter received and filed.
Preliminary hearing on December 18, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program.   Defendant ordered to SCRAM monitoring within 1 business day of posting bail.  Defendant to pay costs associated with SCRAM monitoring.  Defendants who can not  pay will be required to follow an enhanced level of direct supervision requirements as established by WCS.  WCS will notify the Court.   Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.
